title: Woman's bestselling book admits she killed abusive husband
description: The murder trial of a woman who killed her abusive husband got underway in the French city of Chalon-sur-Saône. In her bestselling book, Valerie Bacot, admits to shooting Daniel Polette dead in self-defense in 2016. She faces a life sentence for murder.​

title: Britain has a big education problem. Lawmakers from Boris Johnson's party are trying to make it about 'White privilege'
description: Lawmakers from the UK's governing Conservative party are being accused of weaponizing inequalities in the country's education system to stoke a culture war.

title: How Brazil's fear of losing the Amazon guides Bolsonaro's policies towards the forest
description: In 2000, when the internet in Brazil was still in its infancy, an email with an alarming message about the Amazon went viral. It claimed that the United States and the United Nations had taken the forest from Brazilians and transformed it into a protected area -- a falsehood, but one that reflected a long-running conspiracy theory still promoted today by Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro.

title: Venice could be added to UNESCO's list of 'endangered' heritage sites
description: Venice should be added to UNESCO's list of World Heritage in Danger, advisors to the body have recommended, due to "threats" facing the lagoon city -- including the cruise ships that continue to dock in the city center.

title: Footage shows hoverboard burst into flames in home
description: A video shows a hoverboard catch fire inside a Utah family's home. The family says they purchased the used hoverboard a few weeks ago and that the previous owner told them it was about a year old. Fire investigators were sent to the home and an investigation is underway.

title: Watch Dior's catwalk at 2,000-year-old Athens stadium
description: Dior's Chairman and CEO Pietro Beccari spoke to Julia Chatterley about the label's catwalk show hosted at the 2,000-year-old Panathenaic stadium in Athens. It's the place where the first modern Olympics were held in 1896.

title: Alleged drug kingpin argues Australia illegally had him sent to the Netherlands
description: Lawyers for a Canadian national accused of running a global multibillion-dollar methamphetamine cartel have alleged that he was illegally sent to the Netherlands as part of a scheme to ensure he stays behind bars for as long as possible.

title: Hundreds of stolen artifacts recovered in Italy
description: Italian art police have repatriated an "archaeological treasure trove" of almost 800 stolen artifacts from Belgium in one of the largest operations of its kind in the country.

title: Plan to light up German stadium in rainbow colors for Euro 2020 is rejected
description: European football governing body UEFA has declined a request to light up Munich's Allianz Arena in rainbow colors for Wednesday's Euro 2020 match between Germany and Hungary.

title: Trump wanted to send infected Americans to Guantanamo Bay, book says
description: Washington Post reporter Dan Diamond analyzes a new book that says former President Donald Trump repeatedly suggested sending Americans infected with Covid-19 to Guantanamo Bay.

title: Billie Eilish apologizes after video surfaces of singer mouthing racial slur
description: Superstar singer Billie Eilish has apologized after a video surfaced of her apparently mouthing along to a song as an anti-Asian racial slur is used.

title: Pop culture's biggest mystery may soon be solved
description: In 2009, Britney Spears superfan Megan Radford read a blog post about her idol's new legal arrangement, and something didn't feel right.

title: A Boy Scout troop booked homes on Airbnb. See what they found instead
description: A Boy Scout leader shares his frustrations after realizing that his two home rentals, which were suppose to be near the beach, led him to an empty lot.  CNN affiliate WSVN reports

title: Living with a short sleep gene: 'It's a gift'
description: For as long as he can remember, Brad Johnson knew he was different.

title: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte threatens to jail those who refuse Covid-19 vaccine
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has threatened to jail people who refuse to be vaccinated against the coronavirus as his country battles one of Asia's worst outbreaks, with more than 1.3 million cases and 23,000 deaths.

title: Bitcoin keeps falling as China ramps up the pressure on cryptos even more
description: Bitcoin tanked after China called in a bunch of major commercial lenders — including payments juggernaut Alipay — to warn them about getting into cryptocurrency.

title: Messi equals another record... and signs fan's incredible tattoo
description: Lionel Messi earned his 147th cap for Argentina on Monday, equaling Javier Mascherano's all-time appearance record for La Albiceleste.

title: Reemerging from lockdown? Fashion and beauty tips for a post-confinement world
description: Throughout the pandemic, many of us have daydreamed about what life might look like once the world starts recovering. As we stewed in our tracksuits and traded makeup for skincare, we fantasized about the ordinary: our first haircut, the next date night outfit, wearing lipstick without it smearing all over our masks.

title: Carl Nassib of Las Vegas Raiders is first active NFL player to announce he is gay
description: Carl Nassib, a defensive lineman with the Las Vegas Raiders, became the first active NFL player in league history to announce that he is gay.

title: There may be trouble ahead as dangerous Covid-19 variant appears to cause hospitalization spike in at least one state, expert warns
description: Health officials are pouring their effort into convincing those still hesitant to get vaccinated against Covid-19, but none of the strategies appear to be a "Hail Mary pass" to get the US to reach President Joe Biden's vaccination goal and curb spreading variants.

title: Elephant crashes into a woman's home in search for food, as natural habitats shrink
description: A woman in Thailand found an unexpected visitor in her house in the middle of the night last weekend -- a wild Asian elephant.

title: From 'biggest setback' to 'biggest breakthrough': How Jon Rahm became a major winner
description: Just two weeks ago, Jon Rahm was worrying how his positive Covid-19 result would potentially affect his family -- in particular, his two-month old son.

title: LVMH opens $894 million luxury shopping destination in Paris
description: A historic 19th century landmark, forced to fade into the background along the banks of the river Seine in Paris for 16 years, has been brought out of hibernation and resurrected as a new all-in-one shopping, dining and tourist destination.

title: Mouse plague forces Australian prison to evacuate staff and inmates
description: A plague of mice in the Australian state of New South Wales has forced a prison to evacuate at least 420 inmates and 200 staff, according to local authorities.

title: Covid outbreak in Florida government building kills two people
description: Two people are dead and four of their coworkers were hospitalized after a Covid-19 outbreak swept through a government building in Manatee County, Florida.

title: Bumble just gave its entire staff the week off to recharge
description: Bumble is giving its entire team a break.

title: Paris Fashion Week: How to watch the virtual menswear shows
description: Menswear designers from around the world will unveil new collections in Paris this week during the latest edition of Men's Fashion Week, giving onlookers a first taste of next spring's fashions.

title: Army clashes with anti-junta militia in Mandalay, Myanmar's second-biggest city
description: Myanmar security forces backed by armored vehicles on Tuesday clashed with a newly formed militia group in Mandalay, the country's second-biggest city, according to social media posts from the group and media reports.

title: The Great Barrier Reef is in 'danger,' UN says. Australia disagrees
description: The Great Barrier Reef has deteriorated to such an extent it should be listed as a world heritage site "in danger," a United Nations committee said Tuesday -- prompting immediate backlash from the Australian government.

title: How Democrats can defy history in 2022
description: The huge voter turnout over the past three elections could scramble the usual dynamics of midterm voting -- potentially providing Democrats their best chance to avoid losses next year that could cost them control of the House, the Senate or both.

title: The pandemic wrought a new America
Pakistan PM Imran Khan refuses to condemn China's Xinjiang crackdown
description: Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan refused to condemn the Chinese government's alleged human rights abuses against the Muslim-majority Uyghur people in Xinjiang in an interview with Axios Sunday.

title: The country is heading into a best of times, worst of times summer as deliverance from Covid is tempered by crime, economic false starts and obstacles
description: America is heading into a best of times, worst of times summer as the longed-for promise of deliverance from Covid-19 is tempered by spasms of violent crime, economic false starts and unexpected obstacles on the road to freedom.

title: World's most expensive city in a place you might not guess
description: Ashgabat in Turkmenistan is the most expensive city in the world for overseas workers, according to this year's Mercer Cost of Living Survey.

title: DOJ releases Capitol riot videos from major conspiracy case involving the Proud Boys
description: The Justice Department released three videos on Monday used in a federal court case against a Capitol riot defendant accused of leading the Proud Boys in the insurrection on January 6.

title: 'Every day, I feel really sad': Migrant children still in temporary sites for prolonged periods, attorneys say
description: Migrant children who crossed the US-Mexico border alone are still spending prolonged time in temporary government facilities, raising concerns among attorneys, who say the conditions are inadequate for kids, according to a court filing Monday.

title: Pressure mounts on Trump Organization CFO to cooperate against Donald Trump
description: The Trump Organization's chief financial officer is staring down a decision: whether to cooperate with prosecutors against former President Donald Trump and the Trump Organization or potentially face criminal tax-related charges.

title: Cambodia charges environmentalists with plotting and insulting king
description: A Cambodian court has charged four environmental activists with insulting the country's king and conspiracy to plotting, a prosecutor said on Monday, following the arrest of three of them last week as they documented waste discharge into a city river.

title: Trump Organization sues NYC after golf course contract canceled in wake of Capitol attack
description: The Trump Organization on Monday sued the city of New York after it ended its contract for a golf course at Ferry Point Park in the wake of the attack on the US Capitol on January 6.

title: HBO Max intern's screw-up inspires mass "Dear Intern" confessions. Even Monica Lewinsky chimed in.
description: HBO Max intern's screw-up inspires mass "Dear Intern" confessions. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports even Monica Lewinsky chimed in.

title: After 150 Amazon packages arrived at a woman's home by mistake, she decided to donate the contents to local hospitals
description: A New York woman is giving back to the community after more than 150 Amazon boxes that did not belong to her showed up at her house.

title: What are floating breakfasts, and why have they become so popular?
description: If you follow luxury resorts or travel influencers on Instagram, odds are good that you've seen at least one "floating breakfast."

title: Iconic man-made islands at 20 years old
They stood up to Trump's lies and now are losing their jobs
description: Democrat Helen Butler and Republican Baoky Vu, who have stood up to former President Trump's lies about the 2020 election, are both being removed from their roles on election boards in Georgia after Gov. Brian Kemp signed a law that allows the GOP to appoint members to local election boards.

title: Drinking coffee of any type cuts risk for liver problems, study says
description: Drinking up to three or four cups of caffeinated or decaffeinated coffee a day reduces your risk of developing and dying from chronic liver diseases, a new study found.
